basics.name: Erik Gaal
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary:
Hi there! I’m a software engineer at Superscript, a fintech scale-up on a mission to transform the SME insurance space.

I’m passionate about crafting great experiences—not just for users, but for fellow engineers too. I care deeply about writing clean, well-considered code and enjoy contributing to open-source projects.

Before this, I was at Scrn, where I worked on the Eurovision Song Contest website and built an event-management platform called Accredion from the ground up.

work.summary:
Contributed to a key project that centralized product offerings company-wide.

Driving improvements across the tech organisation to boost developer productivity, enhance delivery quality, and increase software reliability.
work.name: Superscript

work.summary:
At Superscript, I led the modernisation of our backoffice system using FilamentPHP, significantly accelerating feature development. I also introduced quality assurance practices, including static code analysis.

In a follow-up project, I built internal tools for engineers to create insurance products—such as document generation and premium calculators—which drastically reduced the development time for complex offerings.
work.name: Superscript

work.summary: After the previous Lead Developer left to work for a different company, I naturally grew into the role of Lead Developer. I became responsible for all IT projects and infrastructure of the company and clients.
work.name: Scrn

work.summary: I joined the company to build a new SaaS platform for accreditation at events called Accredion. We worked with small team of two developers and two designers to build a product from scratch until running it in production for one of the largest events in the world, the Eurovision Song Contest.
work.name: Scrn

work.summary: Developed new features for the company in-house built CMS through data analytics and UX design which increased the bookers capacity required for the company to grow.
work.name: srprs.me

references.name: Raymond Klompsma
references.reference: Erik is a great guy. He worked almost two years at srprs.me while doing a full time study. He's reliable and really good in his job.

references.name: Tim Beglinger
references.reference: Erik helped srprs.me to solve difficult issues. Due to his full-stack capabilities, in thinking and in developing, the outcome of his work was of high quality. And although he worked part-time for srprs.me, he made sure he was full part of the team.
